Well, one of the fascinating things about the journey of this three films over two decades that Bruce Sinofsky - the co-filmmaker - and I undertook is that when we first went down - we actually arrived in West Memphis, Arkansas, within days of the arrests, embedded ourselves in the community for about eight months prior to the start of the trials.

And frankly, we went down thinking we were making a film about guilty teenagers, because the press reports coming out of West Memphis, Arkansas were as if this was an open-and-shut case with a confession, with - on the scale of one to 10 - the police and chief investigator said on the scale of one to 10, it's an 11.
And so the, you know, what sent us down was actually Sheila Nevins clipping an article.
